data.name: Learn Glass Cutting from a Master
data.desc: Master Stained Glass Artisan Leia Powell has been creating glass masterpieces for over twenty years.  In this 60 minute demonstration, you will learn about how to cut and break glass to fit a pattern.   The fee for this workshop is $10 per person which enters you into a drawing to take home Leia’s creation after the demo! Send your prepayment (this will count as your registration) via PayPal to fearandtrust@yahoo.com OR pay $10 at the door.

data.name: Supplying War / Supplying Your Fictional War
data.desc: Tom Kratman presents Supplying War / Supplying Your Fictional War - What it takes and how to get it right when explaining it from the writers perspective. Tom will have an autograph session during the last 15 minutes.

data.name: The 4 Horseman RT Mass Autograph Session

data.name: Tropes of Modern Urban Fantasy
data.desc: What are the most common and most unique tropes found in Urban Fantasy today. David B. Coe moderates this fascinating discussion.

data.name: Codenames
data.desc: Paul Bielaczyc hosts CODENAMES for 10 - 20 folks.  Codenames is a social word game with a simple premise and challenging game play. Two rival spymasters know the secret identities of 25 agents. Their teammates know the agents only by their codenames. The teams compete to see who can make contact with all of their agents first. Spymasters give one-word clues that can point to multiple words on the table. Their teammates try to guess words of their color while avoiding those that belong to the opposing team. And everyone wants to avoid the assassin. The game works very well with 4 players if you prefer to guess without help. Or you can add more players if you prefer lively discussion. There is also a cooperative variant where a single team tries to achieve the highest score they can by playing against the game itself.

data.name: Why We Can't Go To Mars
data.desc:
Stephen Fleming presents: Why We Can’t Go to Mars

Elon Musk wants to go to Mars, and take millions of people with him. But there are a lot of challenges. Come learn some of the reasons why a crewed Mars mission is likely decades away.

data.name: Pulp Cthulhu

data.name: Tau Zero
data.desc: Since July 2016 Jeff Greason has served as chairman of the Board of the Tau Zero Foundation, a non-profit developing advanced propulsion technologies with relevance to both advanced near-term missions and long-term potential for interstellar probes. The Tau Zero Foundation is also laying out options to U.S. policy makers for very frequent, small payload, unconventional launch strategies to enable affordable space strategies such as boost-phase missile defense.

data.name: ARTC Presentations: "Mercury - A Broadcast of Hope"; "Who is Killing the Great SF Writers of America"; "Nothing at All"
data.desc:
This year's Atlanta Radio Theatre Company (ARTC) presentations will be: An episode of our Daily Podcast: "Mercury - A Broadcast of Hope" (about 5 minutes) After the zombie apocalypse, a handful of people operate a college radio station broadcasting practical tips, advice, and hope.

"Who is Killing the Great Science Fiction Writers of America" - an episode of the series "The Three Galaxateers" - written by Ron N. Butler. During World War II three famous science fiction writers work on war projects for the US government. In this episode they discover that someone is killing other SF writers; starting with Henry Pepper, gun collector and writer of stories about alternate realities.(about 20 minutes)

"Nothing at All" - a fantasy play by Kelley S. Ceccato. In this Celtic fantasy, a young girl, with a talent for medicine, is obliged to treat an evil wizard's sickly, surly son. (about 30 minutes)

data.name: The Care and Feeding of Your Used Book Collection

data.name: Dragonriders of Pern LARP
data.desc:
Dr. Valerie Hampton hosts Dragonriders of Pern LARP: Lord Asgenar has been gifted with a clutch of firelizard eggs from Beauty's last flight and is holding a Gather to celebrate the new little thread flaming helpers. Festivities abound as travelers from all over Lemos make their way to the Gather for it is rumored that Lord Asgenar won't be keeping all the firelizards but doling some out in lottery to help with ground crews. Whether runnerbeast racing, bubbly pies, or a chance at a firelizard is your game the Spring Gather won't disappoint.

Be familiar with Dragonriders of Pern, or even read the Wiki to be set. (Everything will be provided. Groups will be separated by dragonriders, crafters, and holders. Harpers can join any group. Costuming is encouraged.)
All ages can participate.

data.name: Unconventional Art (Creating Outside the Box)
data.desc: They are few and far between, masters in their craft, and ready to talk to YOU about it! Not every artist paints and draws, sit in with these LC Veterans and see why they chose to think outside the box! From stained glass to chainmail. jewelry to diorama creation to puppetry, these artists are incredible craftspeople just waiting to share their passion with you! Leia Powell (mod.)

data.name: World Building Across the Genres
data.desc: Dan Hollifield  moderates this panel on what it takes to build a believe-able nuanced world as a landscape for fantasy, science fiction, steampunk or horror.

data.name: Nerd Music Free For All
data.desc: Open Filking with Gray Rinehart

data.name: Kids Dungeons and Dragons Edition 3.5
data.desc: Taylor Hoch will run this Edition 3.5 campaign designed for kids, but available for all comers.

data.name: Reading:  Joe Meany & Daniel Humphreys
data.desc: Come out and join our authors as they read passages from their works.

data.name: Are You a Werewolf? Kids Edition
data.desc: Valerie Hampton  moderates this kid friendly version of Are You a Werewolf?

data.name: The Future of Power Storage Technologies
data.desc: David Bogen will moderate this panel discussion on the future of power storage technologies, to include traditional and alternative fuels.

data.name: Rams Head Book Launch / Room Party
data.desc: Rams Head Books presents the Book Launch Party for Taylor S Hoch’s Volume 6 of the continuing saga of Prospero Clydesdale O’Shaunesssy’s “Curse of the Dullahan” series, “Seizing the Stone.”

data.name: Fireside Chats: 3 Short Science Talks on Brain Science
data.desc: Robert E. Hampson, Brent Roeder and Nik Rao are clinical scientists studying learning & memory, prosthetics, brain imaging and psychiatry.  They will give short talks from their area of expertise discussing current medical efforts to understand the human brain and keep it healthy.

data.name: Space Pioneers
data.desc: Sarah Hoyt and Jeff Greason dish on the new anthology Space Pioneers and the spirit of exploration.

data.name: Private Event Teardown / Karaoke Setup
data.desc: Private Event Teardown / Karaoke Setup

data.name: Freehold: Resistance Roundtable
data.desc: Michael. Z. Williamson will moderate this roundtable on the next installment of the Freehold series Resistance, followed by a Mass Autograph session.

data.name: Freehold: Resistance Mass Autograph Session
data.desc: Freehold: Resistance Mass Autograph Session following the RT.

data.name: Falstaff Spotlight
data.desc: Author and Publisher John Hartness will discuss on what's new from Falstaff Publishing.

data.name: The Omega War - the New 4 Horseman Universe Game
data.desc: Join Chris Kennedy, Mark Wandrey and Jon Osborne for the debut of the new Kickstartergame "The Omega War" from the New 4 Horseman Universe.

data.name: "Art in Science or the Science in Art?"
data.desc: An engineer presents images and videos.  Are they Art?  Or are they Science? The artist's make their ruling and then announce the results.  Arguments will ensue!

data.name: Critters
data.desc: Kal Spriggs moderates:  You've 'built' that quirky planet you 'd like to play on. Now you need some critters that could evolve and survive there. What issues do you need to consider in designing them? A rough planet design will be provided as the focus for the discussion.

data.name: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Writing Advice
data.desc: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Writing Advice - a discussion of common writing tips and how to evaluate what advice is right for you. Anna Grace Carpenter moderates.

data.name: From Pinplants to the Terminal Man: Can Science Build the Better Humans Envisioned by SF?
data.desc: Brain implants are a common feature of Science Fiction.  Science is rapidly catching up with Science Fiction in developing computer interfaces, connection with robotic limbs, and the means to treat disorders of the brain. Science Fiction still holds the high ground with respect to downloading  memories and developing hybrid human-computer AIs and cyborgs; but Science is closing in with prosthetics and transcranial stimulation to treat a number of disorders.  What is fact?  What is (still) fiction? Where can science and science fiction go from here? Dr. Robert Hampson moderates.

data.name: Back to the Moon!
data.desc: Stephen Fleming presents :Back to the Moon!  Five decades ago, humans first set foot on the Moon. Now, it’s time to go back... this time, to stay! Join us for a discussion of how we’ll get there, what we’ll do, and why it’s important.

data.name: The Challenges of Cyberwarfare
data.desc: Rich Weyand moderates this panel on the challenges of waging and survivng cyberwarfare.

data.name: Beamed Energy Launch
data.desc: Starting in February 2016 Jeff Greason began served as CTO of Electric Sky, where he invented a number of new wireless power transfer technologies for unconventional space launch and other purposes. He hosts this panel discussion on the promise of beamed energy launches.

data.name: Indy Author Resources Panel
data.desc: Bad Ash Publishing owner Melissa Todd moderates this panel on where to find the best tools to assist independent authors.

data.name: Understanding Relativity (General and Special)
data.desc: Dr. Ben Davis will attempt to explain Einstein's Theory of Relativity in under an hour! Come and be amazed.....

data.name: Nuclear Weapons 101
data.desc: Ken Roy moderates this panel discussion on Nuclear Weaponry, Radiation and nuclear effects.

data.name: 500 Vampires, No Waiting
data.desc: 500 Vampires, No Waiting: How many vampire types are out there? Do you prefer the supernatural? The aliens? The Wesley Snipes movies? Declan Finn moderates this panel on the many varieties of Nosferatu.

data.name: Constructing the Blade Files: Looking at Cyberpunk from a Different Perspective
data.desc: Constructing the Blade Files: Looking at Cyberpunk from a Different Perspective. It doesn't have to be grunge, despair, and dystopia to be CYBERPUNK!  Daniel Allen Butler and Scott Bragg will discuss their vision of and plans for expanding the range of the genre, as well as its meaning, with their near-future series of novels, The Blade Files.

data.name: Ultimate Are You a Werewolf? Teens/Adults Edition
data.desc: Valerie Hampton hosts this Ultimate Werewolf edition for teens and adults.

data.name: Rise of the Fae
data.desc: First it was the vampires, then the werewolves, now we have the fae. In the past five years, fae have risen in popularity as subjects for urban fantasy tales. Are fae the new vampires? Or have they always been there? Why are they so popular now and where do we see them going in the future? Join a panel of experts as they discuss these latest writing trends in relation popular culture, art and the business of writing itself. Lydia Sherrer moderates.

data.name: The Allure of Pirates
data.desc: Tamara Lowery moderates this panel on the allure of Pirates, be they at sea or in space.

data.name: "Inner Demons" and other Short Film Screenings
data.desc: A slew of short films by Award Winning Film Maker Robert S. Evans.  Come and walk through this journey of various films from his career, as well as a showing of his newest horror short film, "Inner Demons", about a Paranormal Investigator who doesn't believe in what he does finding out that things are far more real than he ever imagined.

data.name: The Art of Visual Storytelling
data.desc: Have you ever watched a movie and walked away wondering exactly how they got you to feel the way they did?  How did they manage to get those sensations in such a short amount of time?  Everything that is in the frame means something, from the angle, to the color, to where someone is standing.  Award-Winning independent film maker Robert S. Evans walks through and teaches the fascinating world of telling a story through visual media.

data.name: The Supernatural and Shamanic Traditions in Literature
data.desc: Holly McClure moderates this panel on how the supernatural and shamanic traditions are portrayed in fantasy literature.

data.name: How to Write Compelling Short Stories
data.desc: Lou Antonelli moderates this panel on the art of writing in the short story format.

data.name: Writing with a Co-Author
data.desc: Melissa Todd moderates this panel on Co-Authoring: How to write a novel or series with another person. Tips, tricks, struggles, and tools.

data.name: Learning to See: How to examine a visual image and translate it into a wearable costume
data.desc: "Learning to See--How to examine a visual image and translate it to wearable costume". Professional Costume Designer Jonna Haydn presents. So many people want to make something they've seen in movies, anime, or art, but don't have any idea where to start. She will  walk people through various images, examining the structure, layers, fabric content, and construction ideas so they can strategize on how to build their dream costume.

data.name: Industrial vs. Mecha
data.desc: Industrial / Mechanical Engineers square off against Mecha authors to discuss "Mech" realism and the realm of the possible. William Joseph Roberts moderates.

data.name: Meet and Greet the First Timers!
data.desc: Come welcome and get familliar with some of our first time at LibertyCon pros.  John Ringo will host.

data.name: This is ARTC!
data.desc: Members of the Atlanta Radio Theater Company (ARTC) discuss the history of and what it takes to become, as member ot the institution!

data.name: Reading:  Tom Kratman & Mark Wandrey
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our author guest reads passages of their works

data.name: Reading:  Gray Rinehart & David B. Coe / D.B. Jackson
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our author guests reads passages of their works.

data.name: Closing Ceremonies - Let's Bitch at Brandy
data.desc: Did you have a great time at the convention? Or was there something that absolutely irritated you? Either way, come out and let us know at our Closing Ceremonies.

data.name: What's New From Copper Dog Publishing
data.desc: Publisher Michael Hanson and his authors talk about what's new this year from Copper Dog Publishing / Moondream Press.

data.name: What's New in 1632 / Grantville Roundtable
data.desc: Rick Boatright moderates this panel on what is new in the 1632 / Grantville universe in all it's alternate history glory, with a mass autograph session to follow.

data.name: The Art of Editing
data.desc: Seasoned editors discuss the tricks of the trade. Jim Minz moderates.

data.name: Reading: Phil Wohlrab & Karen Bogen
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our author guests read passages from their works

data.name: Reading: Michael J. Allen & D. Alan Lewis
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our authors reads passages of their works

data.name: Reading: Tamara Lowery & David L. Burkhead
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our author guests reads passages of their works

data.name: Reading: S. Andrew Swann &
data.desc: Come out and have a seat as our author guests reads passages of their works

data.name: Celebrity Jeopardy
data.desc: Watch as Alan Andrews, Amanda Makepeace and John Hartness battle it out with fast answers on Art, Science, Literature and other fun topics. There can be only ONE!

data.name: Author's / Artist's Alley (Beckwith, Gibbons, H.P. & J. Holo, C. Kennedy, Schantz)
data.desc: Come by the Author's / Artist's Alley to chat, buy a book or get an autograph!

data.name: Author's Alley (Q. Allen, J. Hunter, Malone, McKeown, Spriggs)
data.desc: Come by the Author's / Artist's Alley to chat, buy a book or get an autograph!

data.desc: Have coffee / continental breakfast and chat with the pros.

data.desc: Come by the Author's / Artist's Alley to chat, buy a book or get an autograph!

data.name: Writing within Pop Culture
data.desc: Martin Powell and David Boop discuss the mechanics of producing literature for media tie-ins and pop culture.

data.name: Balloons of Doom
data.desc: Doc Osborn unleashes controlled chaos with his balloons of doom!

data.name: New Homes for Humanity: Terraforming Mercury and Venus
data.desc: Ken Roy gives a fascinating presentation on what the future could hold with respect to terraforming Mercury and Venus.

data.name: Steve Jackson Games - Open Gaming
data.desc: Steve Jackson Games will demo new and familiar games - come one, come all!

data.name: The Art of Mitch Foust
data.desc: Mitch Foust discovered a passion for Fantasy, art, and history at an early age. He started his art career producing comic books in the black and white comic boom of the 1980’s. Foust has gone on to produce many illustrations for comics, book covers, role playing games, and t-shirts. Mitch has developed a fascination with textures and details in his work. He strives for as much realism as possible, creating his own unique look to his fantasy paintings. Since 2009, he has compiled his work into an annual Yearbook.

data.name: Voices of The Fall Roundtable - The Black Tide Rising Anthology Continues
data.desc: Come join John Ringo and his motley crew of authors for their roundtable on the next installment of the Black Tide Rising anthology. Will be followed by a mass autograph session. Gary Poole, Mod.

data.name: Voices of The Fall Mass Autograph Session
data.desc: Mass Autograph Session immediately following the Voices of the Fall Roundtable. The Black Tide Rising Anthology Continues

data.name: Humor in SF and Fantasy
data.desc: Ed McKeown moderates this panel on the tricks of the trade in adding humor to your science fiction or fantasy story or novel

data.name: Reading:  Nik Rao & Lou Antonelli
data.desc: Hear our authors read from their various works.

data.name: Paranormal Romance Panel and Fan Q&A - What's In and What's Out

data.name: SIGMA, Futurism and Science Fiction
data.desc: Dr. Arlan Andrews, the Director of SIGMA, the Science Fiction Think Tank that consults for the USG, will moderate this panel with other members of SIGMA on what they do and how science fiction informs futurism

data.name: Superversive Press Mass Autograph Session

data.name: Author's / Artist's Alley (Duntemann, J. Hunter, Ibson, Spriggs, Weyand)

data.name: Pantsing For Beginners
data.desc: Authors Rob Howell and Rich Weyand and Stephanie Osborn -- all write without an outline -- will teach their process for beginners who just can't seem to get that first novel done.

data.name: Kickstarter, Patreon and the World of Crowdfunding
data.desc: Artist Guest of Honor Mitch Foust will host this discussion on Kickstarter, Patreon and the World of Crowdfunding.

data.name: Creature Features:  The Worlds of Bubba the Monster Hunter
data.desc: Author and Master of Ceremonies John Hartness  presents Creature Features – the Worlds of Bubba the Monster Hunter, where he will talk about monsters he has used, and the critters in the expanded Bubbaverse books as well.

data.name: Changes in the Power Infrastructure
data.desc: Jay Roye moderates this panel on the US and Global Power Infrastructure and how it is evolving.

data.name: New Manuscript Critique Workshop
data.desc: John Holmes of Cannon Publishing will critique your new manuscript in this hands-on workshop - 3-5 pages max.

data.name: Hank Reinhardt Fight Team Demonstration
data.desc: Whit Williams hosts the Hank Reinhardt Fight Team Demonstration.

data.name: Science Fiction in Video Games
data.desc: Science Fiction in Video Games: A discussion on various types of science fiction types and tropes in video games over the years. What has been popular, what worked in the gaming world, what didn’t, and what will be releasing in the near future. Gerry Martin hosts.
